Interface LinkerTableInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
LinkerTable
public interface LinkerTableInterface

This class is an object class. It holds the symbol table from the linker. It has three fields: Name, type, and location, where name is the program or variable name, type is start or ent, and location is the linker assigned memory location.

Author:
Everett

Method Summary

          This method adds a symbol to the symbol table
 boolean changeLocation(java.lang.String name, int location)
          This method changes the location of a pre-existing variable in the table.

          This method returns an int representing the stored length
 int getLocation(java.lang.String name)
          This method returns the assigned location of the variable name.
 void increaseLength(int integer)
          This method increases the stored length variable by integer.
 boolean isDefined(java.lang.String name)
          This method will return true if the variable is defined in the table.
 void print()
          This method will print out the symbol table to the console.
 void printToFile()
          This method will print out the symbol table into a file called "GlobalSymbolTable.txt".
 

Method Detail

add

boolean add(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String type,
            int location)
This method adds a symbol to the symbol table

Parameters:
name - = variable name
type - = type of variable: start or ent
location - = int value of linker assigned mem address
Returns:
true if successful, false if name already exists

changeLocation

boolean changeLocation(java.lang.String name,
                       int location)
This method changes the location of a pre-existing variable in the table.

Parameters:
name - = the name of the variable to be changed
location - = the new location
Returns:
true if successful, false if the variable didn't exist in the table.

isDefined

boolean isDefined(java.lang.String name)
This method will return true if the variable is defined in the table.

Parameters:
name - = the name of the variable to search for
Returns:
true if name exists, false if not

getLocation

int getLocation(java.lang.String name)
This method returns the assigned location of the variable name.

Parameters:
name - = the name of the variable to retrieve the location for
Returns:
int location of name

print

void print()
This method will print out the symbol table to the console.

printToFile

                 throws java.io.IOException
This method will print out the symbol table into a file called "GlobalSymbolTable.txt".

Throws:
java.io.IOException

increaseLength

This method increases the stored length variable by integer.

Parameters:
